column2: MAINE DMV DRIVING TEST
column6: ME

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.
column6: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.
column8: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.

column2: 2. Your red traffic signal changes to green while a pedestrian is crossing in your traffic lane. The right of way should be given:
column6: by the pedestrian, but only when vehicles are turning left.
column8: by the pedestrian.

column2: 3. While inside the roundabout, you should:
column4: change lanes before you check for vehicles behind you.
column6: use your left turn signal if you are in position to exit now.
column8: remain in your lane until you are ready to exit.

column2: 4. If you missed your exit on a freeway, you should:
column4: make a quick U-turn from your lane of travel.
column6: None of the above.
column8: use the right turn signal, check your mirrors and move to the right.
column10: go to the next exit and come back to the exit you missed.

column2: 5. A flashing yellow traffic signal means:
column6: Slow down and be alert at the upcoming intersection.
column8: Stop and proceed when a green light appears.
column10: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column4: Pass only in the right lane
column6: Merging traffic ahead
column8: No left turn
column10: Cars in right lane must slow down

column2: 7. Before crossing any railroad tracks, you must:
column6: wait until the crossing gates are completely up.
column8: make sure there is room for your vehicle on the other side.

column2: 8. Do not pass:
column6: when approaching intersections.
column8: when school bus lights are flashing.

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column6: Turn left at the intersection
column8: Lane shifting

column2: 10. Distractions that take your attention away from driving can be caused by ______ while driving.
column6: using your cell phone
column8: changing the radio

column2: 11. You may drive faster than the posted speed limit:
column6: when passing another vehicle, as long as it is safe to do so.
column8: when your lane is empty.

column2: 12. Which of the following is a common cause of a traffic collisions?
column6: Distracted driving.
column8: Following too closely.

column2: 13. When you pass another vehicle, before you return to the right lane, you must:
column4: look at your interior rear-view mirror.
column6: make sure you can see the front bumper of the vehicle you passed.
column8: signal.

column2: 14. Does a vehicle prepared to enter a traffic circle or rotary have right-of-way over vehicles in the circle?
column4: Only if the light is green.
column6: Yes, but only if they are entering the rotary from the right lane.
column8: No. Vehicles already in the circle have the right-of-way.

column2: 15. When driving on slippery roads, drivers should:
column6: avoid crossing bridges or intersections.
column8: increase their following distance.

column2: 16. If a traffic signal light is green and a police officer signals you to stop:
column6: you should obey the traffic signal.
column8: you can tell the officer that signs and signals take precedence over directions given by traffic officers.

column2: 17. After passing a vehicle, it is safe to return to your lane:
column4: when you can no longer see the vehicle over your right shoulder.
column6: when you see the front bumper of the other vehicle in your mirror.
column8: after about five seconds.
column10: when you are 50 feet ahead of the vehicle.

column2: 18. In work zones, barriers such as drums, panels and cones are used to:
column4: keep workers out of the work zone.
column6: reduce the flow of traffic.
column8: keep traffic out of hazardous work zones.

column2: 19. When passing you should NOT:
column4: go far enough past the vehicle you are passing so that you can see the vehicle in your inside rearview mirror.
column6: leave less than 4 feet of space between your vehicle and the vehicle you are passing.
column8: look in your rearview mirrors and glance over your shoulder before pulling out to pass.
column10: signal left to let others know that you will be pulling out.

column2: 20. Which statement about taking medications and driving is true?
column4: Over the counter drugs do not affect driving ability.
column6: Prescribed drugs are safe to take at any time.
column8: Cold medications can make a person drowsy.

column2: 21. Roads are the most slippery:
column4: the first rain after a dry spell.
column6: after it has been raining for an hour or more.
column8: for the first 2 hours of a rain storm.

column2: 22. Before entering an intersection, drivers should look:
column6: left.
column8: right, left, then right again.

column2: 23. When you see this sign, you should:
column4: slow down and look for trains.
column6: come to a complete stop.
column8: move quickly toward the oncoming train.
column10: look for a train station ahead.

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column6: Pedestrians must not cross
column8: School zone ahead

column2: 25. If your vehicle has a mechanical problem, you should:
column4: signal and pull into the slow lane.
column6: stop in your lane and put on your emergency flashers.
column8: turn on your hazard lights and pull off the road.

column2: 26. Before turning, you should:
column6: change lanes.
column8: sound your horn to alert the other drivers.

column2: 27. If you see a “lane closed ahead” sign you should:
column4: speed to the end of the closed lane and try to get into the other lane.
column6: merge into the correct lane when it is safe.
column8: make a U-turn. You are on the wrong side of the road.

column2: 28. This road sign means:
column4: No turns are allowed on this road
column6: Do Not Enter
column8: Winding Road Ahead

column2: 29. At a stop sign there is no stop line, you must stop:
column6: before you enter the crosswalk.
column8: after you enter the crosswalk.
column10: before the traffic light turns red.

column2: 30. This road sign means:
column6: No Turning
column8: Two-way Traffic

column2: 31. If you are feeling tired while driving, you should:
column6: open a window.
column8: drink coffee.

column2: 32. You can reduce the chance of a collision with a large vehicle if you:
column6: pull in front of the large vehicle before you can see the whole front of the vehicle in your mirror.
column8: cut abruptly in front of it.
column10: pay close attention to the turn signals.

column2: 33. What do flashing red lights on a school bus indicate?
column4: The bus is about to stop.
column6: You must pass the school bus.
column8: Traffic that approaches from either direction may proceed.
column10: The bus is stopped to load or discharge passengers.

column2: 34. When a hazard is seen ahead, reaction distance:
column4: is the sum of perception distance and braking distance.
column6: equals total stopping distance minus perception distance.
column8: is how far a vehicle will continue to travel, in ideal conditions, before the driver hits the brakes.

column2: 35. This road sign means:
column6: Detour ahead
column8: No left turn

column2: 36. This sign means:
column4: Curve ahead, drive at 40 MPH ot more around the curve ahead
column6: Curve ahead, the recommended speed is 40 MPH or less
column8: If you are driving at 40 MPH or less you must turn to the right
column10: If you are driving at 40 MPH or less you must stay in the right-hand lane

column2: 37. If you approach a flashing red traffic light, you should treat the intersection the same as:
column6: a yield sign.
column8: a stop sign.

column2: 38. This road sign means:
column6: Pedestrian crossing
column8: Bicycle crossing

column2: 39. Vehicle stopping distance never depends on:
column4: the condition and type of vehicle tires.
column6: the time of day.
column8: the condition of your vehicle's brakes.

column2: 40. If you suddenly have no control of the steering wheel, you should:
column4: react as you would with a blowout.
column6: ease your foot off the gas pedal. Turn on your emergency flashers and allow your vehicle to come to a slow stop.
column8: pump your brake pedal to build pressure.
column10: turn on your emergency flashers and pull off the road.

column2: 41. Only _____ can reduce the alcohol level in the blood.
column6: time
column8: taking a cold shower

column2: 42. If your accelerator becomes stuck while driving, you should:
column4: hold the steering wheel firmly and turn the ignition off while the vehicle is moving.
column6: turn the engine off and try to drive the car safely off the roadway.
column8: shift to neutral, apply the brakes and try to drive the car safely off the road.
column10: shift to park and apply the brakes until you come to a complete stop.

column2: 43. You may park or stop along the shoulder of the freeway:
column4: if you need to check your smartphone for directions.
column6: only if you have an emergency.
column8: as long as you turn on your emergency flashers.
column10: if no part of your vehicle is on the road.

column2: 44. This road sign means:
column6: No right turn
column8: Left turns are permitted
column10: You may turn right after yielding the right-of-way to oncoming traffic

column2: 45. A road is likely to be most slippery:
column6: when tire marks have been left by other vehicles.
column8: when icy and the temperature is near freezing.

column2: 46. Highway markings:
column6: are usually red and blue in color.
column8: provide information for drivers.
column10: are only found in school zones.

column2: 47. To enter a freeway:
column4: make a complete stop before entering the freeway.
column6: drive slowly so you can check traffic.
column8: signal, yield, and enter at the same speed that traffic is moving.
column10: signal and enter the freeway. You have the right-of-way.

column2: 48. When you see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights behind you, you should:
column4: immediately come to a complete stop.
column6: keep moving slowly, staying to the right side of the road.
column8: disregard the signal if there are other lanes available for the emergency vehicle.
column10: slow down, provide a clear path for the emergency vehicle and stop.

column2: 49. Studies show that wearing seat belts:
column4: increases your chances of fatality in a crash.
column6: reduces your chances of damaging your car in a crash.
column8: reduces your chances of serious injury in a crash.

column2: 50. Drivers may cross a double yellow line to pass another vehicle if:
column4: the yellow line next to the other side of the road is broken.
column6: the yellow line next to their side of the road is broken.
column8: the vehicle ahead moves to the right to let them pass.

column2: 51. When driving in fog, drivers should use high beam headlights.
column6: False

column2: 52. To avoid hydroplaning, drivers should:
column6: slow down.
column8: drive at a constant speed.

column2: 53. Before a school bus stops to load passengers, the driver will usually flash:
column6: green lights.
column8: yellow warning lights.

column2: 54. When passing another vehicle:
column4: you can exceed the posted speed limit.
column6: pass the vehicle as safely and as quickly as possible.
column8: there is no need to signal.
column10: honk your horn repeatedly to warn the other driver.

column2: 55. A steady yellow light at an intersection means:
column4: Proceed with caution through the intersection
column6: Immediately come to a complete stop
column8: Yield to other vehicles
column10: Slow down and be prepared to stop

column2: 56. When approaching a curve, remember to:
column4: accelerate slightly before entering the curve.
column6: slow down before entering the curve.
column8: drive at the posted speed limit throughout the curve.
column10: drive at the posted speed limit as you enter the curve, then slow down gradually.

column2: 57. When you see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights behind you, you must:
column6: stop as quickly as you can.
column8: drive to the right edge of the road and slow down.
column10: pull over to the right and stop.

column2: 58. Drivers must be prepared for anything coming up in the road ahead. They should:
column4: scan the road for traffic conditions and possible hazards.
column6: stare straight ahead at all times.
column8: maintain focus toward the left of the road.
column10: drive with the right foot resting lightly on the brake pedal.

column2: 59. Drivers who eat and drink while driving:
column6: may have trouble controlling their vehicles.
column8: have no driving errors.

column2: 60. When preparing to drive, you should:
column6: shift the transmission to neutral.
column8: adjust your seat and mirrors.
